title: Beethoven's Emperor Concerto
description:
Otto Tausk conducts the VSO in a program featuring acclaimed pianist Jan Lisiecki performing Beethoven's majestic 'Emperor' Concerto. The program opens with Jocelyn Morlock's captivating 'Oiseaux Bleus et Sauvages' and concludes with Dvořák's spirited Symphony No. 8, a work brimming with Czech folk melodies and pastoral charm. PROGRAM: JOCELYN MORLOCK: Oiseaux Bleus et Sauvages
BEETHOVEN: Piano Concerto No. 5 in E-flat Major, Op. 73 'Emperor'
DVOŘÁK: Symphony No. 8 in G Major, Op. 88 ARTISTS: Conductor: Otto Tausk Jan Lisiecki, piano PERFORMANCE DETAILS: Date: Friday, September 19, 2025 Time: 8:00 PM Venue: Orpheum Theatre Duration: Approximately 2 hours

venue.name: Orpheum Theatre
venue.description: The Orpheum is a designated National Heritage Site and Vancouver's most elegant theatre. With its elaborately decorated interior and excellent acoustics, this venue is the VSO's main performing venue and one of the most beautiful concert halls in North America.

title: Mozart & Mahler
description:
Guest conductor Gemma New leads the VSO in a powerful program pairing Mozart's elegant Piano Concerto No. 21 featuring soloist Inon Barnatan with Mahler's profoundly moving Symphony No. 4, featuring soprano Dorothea Röschmann in the ethereal final movement. PROGRAM: MOZART: Piano Concerto No. 21 in C Major, K. 467
MAHLER: Symphony No. 4 in G Major ARTISTS: Conductor: Gemma New Inon Barnatan, piano; Dorothea Röschmann, soprano PERFORMANCE DETAILS: Date: Friday, October 10, 2025 Time: 8:00 PM Venue: Orpheum Theatre Duration: Approximately 2 hours 15 minutes

title: Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto
description:
James Gaffigan conducts the VSO with star violinist Augustin Hadelich in Tchaikovsky's technically demanding and emotionally expressive Violin Concerto. The program begins with Gabriela Lena Frank's 'Elegia Andina' and concludes with Rachmaninoff's lush and melodic Symphony No. 2. PROGRAM: GABRIELA LENA FRANK: Elegía Andina
TCHAIKOVSKY: Violin Concerto in D Major, Op. 35
RACHMANINOFF: Symphony No. 2 in E minor, Op. 27 ARTISTS: Conductor: James Gaffigan Augustin Hadelich, violin PERFORMANCE DETAILS: Date: Friday, November 7, 2025 Time: 8:00 PM Venue: Orpheum Theatre Duration: Approximately 2 hours 20 minutes

title: Vivaldi's Four Seasons
description:
Concertmaster Nicholas Wright leads the VSO string section in this special presentation of Vivaldi's beloved 'Four Seasons,' interspersed with Astor Piazzolla's innovative 'Four Seasons of Buenos Aires,' creating a fascinating dialogue between Baroque and tango traditions. PROGRAM: VIVALDI: The Four Seasons, Op. 8, Nos. 1-4
PIAZZOLLA: The Four Seasons of Buenos Aires ARTISTS: Conductor: Nicholas Wright Nicholas Wright, violin PERFORMANCE DETAILS: Date: Friday, December 5, 2025 Time: 8:00 PM Venue: Chan Centre for the Performing Arts Duration: Approximately 1 hours 50 minutes

venue.name: Chan Centre for the Performing Arts
venue.description: The Chan Centre for the Performing Arts at UBC is a magnificent performance facility renowned for its exceptional acoustics and intimate ambiance. The Chan Centre houses the Chan Shun Concert Hall, a 1,185-seat theatre with superb acoustics, making it ideal for musical performances.

title: Holst's The Planets
description:
Otto Tausk conducts the VSO in a cosmic journey through Holst's monumental suite 'The Planets,' featuring the ethereal voices of the VSO Women's Chorus. The concert opens with Kaija Saariaho's mesmerizing 'Ciel d'hiver' and John Adams' pulsating 'Short Ride in a Fast Machine.' PROGRAM: KAIJA SAARIAHO: Ciel d'hiver
JOHN ADAMS: Short Ride in a Fast Machine
HOLST: The Planets, Op. 32 ARTISTS: Conductor: Otto Tausk VSO Women's Chorus PERFORMANCE DETAILS: Date: Friday, December 12, 2025 Time: 8:00 PM Venue: Orpheum Theatre Duration: Approximately 2 hours 5 minutes

title: Surrey Nights: Brahms & Sibelius
description:
The VSO brings a powerful program to Surrey featuring Sibelius' majestic Symphony No. 2 and Brahms' dramatic Piano Concerto No. 1 with acclaimed pianist Saleem Ashkar. PROGRAM: BRAHMS: Piano Concerto No. 1 in D minor, Op. 15
SIBELIUS: Symphony No. 2 in D Major, Op. 43 ARTISTS: Conductor: Otto Tausk Saleem Ashkar, piano PERFORMANCE DETAILS: Date: Wednesday, October 22, 2025 Time: 8:00 PM Venue: Bell Performing Arts Centre Duration: Approximately 2 hours 10 minutes

venue.name: Bell Performing Arts Centre
venue.description: The Bell Performing Arts Centre is a 1,052-seat theatre in Surrey featuring excellent acoustics and sightlines, designed for concerts, theatre, and dance performances.
